article:
Transthyretin ('TTR') is a serum and cerebrospinal fluid carrier of the thyroid
hormone thyroxine (T4) and retinol-binding protein bound to retinol. This is how
transthyretin gained its name, 'trans'ports 'thy'roxine and 'retin'ol. The liver
secretes transthyretin into the blood, and the choroid plexus secretes TTR into
the cerebrospinal fluid.

TTR was originally called prealbumin (or thyroxine-binding
prealbumin) because it ran faster than albumin on electrophoresis gels.
